x-data.description: Declares a new component scope. The expression is evaluated once and its return value becomes the component's data object.

x-init.description: Runs an expression when a component is initialized. Can be used to run code when an element is added to the DOM.

x-show.description: Toggles visibility of an element based on the truthiness of the expression.
x-show.example: This element is visible when open is true

x-bind.description: Dynamically sets HTML attributes. The attribute name is specified after the colon.

x-on.description: Attaches an event listener to an element. The event name is specified after the colon.

x-model.description: Creates two-way data bindings. Works with input, textarea, select, and checkbox elements.

x-text.description: Sets the text content of an element to the result of the expression.

x-html.description: Sets the inner HTML of an element to the result of the expression. Use with caution to avoid XSS vulnerabilities.

x-ref.description: Creates a reference to an element that can be accessed via $refs.

x-if.description: Conditionally renders an element. The element is removed from the DOM when false. Must be used on a template tag.

x-for.description: Creates a new DOM node for each item in an array. Must be used on a template tag.

x-transition.description: Applies transition classes at various stages throughout an element's transition.
x-transition.example: Content

x-effect.description: Runs an expression whenever a reactive dependency changes. Similar to x-init but reactive.

x-cloak.description: Hides elements until Alpine has finished initializing. Useful for preventing flash of unstyled content.

x-ignore.description: Prevents Alpine from initializing on the element and all child elements.

x-id.description: Generates a unique ID based on the provided string. Useful for creating unique IDs for form elements.

x-teleport.description: Teleports an element to another part of the DOM. Useful for modals and tooltips.
x-teleport.example: This content will be moved to the body

x-modelable.description: Makes a component property bindable with x-model.

$el.description: Magic property that references the root element of the component.

$refs.description: Magic property that provides access to elements marked with x-ref.

$store.description: Magic property that provides access to global Alpine stores.

$watch.description: Magic method that watches a component property for changes.

$dispatch.description: Magic method that dispatches a custom event that can be listened to with x-on or @.

$nextTick.description: Magic method that executes a callback after Alpine has finished updating the DOM.

$root.description: Magic property that references the root Alpine component.

$data.description: Magic property that returns the raw data object for the current component.

$id.description: Magic method that generates a unique ID based on the provided string.
